content:
The University of Florida supports its student athletes in balancing academics and athletics through several programs and services:

1. Academic Advising - Each student-athlete is assigned an academic advisor who helps them create a plan for degree completion and provides support throughout their college career.

2. Tutoring Services - The university provides tutoring services for student-athletes in a variety of subjects to help them stay on top of their coursework.

3. Study Hall - Mandatory study halls are held for student-athletes to provide a structured environment for studying and completing homework.

4. Time Management Skills - The University of Florida offers time management courses and workshops specifically tailored for student-athletes.

5. Priority Registration - Student-athletes have priority registration, which allows them to choose their classes and schedule around their practice and competition schedules.

6. Travel Accommodations - The university makes special accommodations for student-athletes traveling for competitions, such as arranging for them to take exams on the road.

7. Career Development - The university offers career development services to help student-athletes plan for their future after sports, including resume building and job search strategies.

Overall, the University of Florida is committed to supporting its student-athletes in all areas of their lives, including academics, athletics, and career development.
